author: samcm
content: Yup we have all of this data already, I'll have a look at making the data more accessible today üî•

author: samcm
content:
<@755590043632140352> you are talking about bad beacon blocks right? Not bad execution blocks? We don't have any recent bad beacon blocks in tracoor: https://tracoor.mainnet.ethpandaops.io/beacon_bad_block

If you've got any hashes handy that'd be awesome üôè

author: potuz
content: I'm actually particularly interested in execution blocks. But the way they will manifest is by also making the beacon block root invalid. I don' t have any hashes right now but can look tomorrow (dead tired here today). But just to be sure: you guys keep the attestations for these blocks? or just the blocks. What I am trying to find out is if there are pools that are attesting blindly to invalid blocks. Altough it may be hard: if I went above and beyond to run without an EL, I would also only attest to blocks that others are already attesting.

author: samcm
content: Oooo interesting! We've got plenty of bad execution blocks so can work backwards from there. We store all the attestations that we see on the p2p layer so we should have the data for this. Will let you know how we go

author: potuz
content: WTF! you guys rock! how long of a buffer do you have to hold all attestations?

author: potuz
content: I assume you drop them after a few days only right?

author: samcm
content:
We store them forever in clickhouse atm üòÜ 

- Attestations from the beacon api event stream since July 2023
- Attestations from the p2p layer since May 2024

author: samcm
content: Last I looked its around 1.2T rows (multiple instances & networks)

author: potuz
content: wow, this is glorious! then yes, you surely have the info I need. Awesome

author: potuz
content: Let' s talk tomorrow, I do need to go to bed üôÇ

author: samcm
content:
I've created 2 dashboards to help with this. There's a bit of a discoverability issue with mapping invalid execution block hashes back to beacon block hashes, but we can capture more data to help with that. Will be rolled out tomorrow.

1. A `Block Finder` dashboard: https://grafana.observability.ethpandaops.io/goto/Leuz7tCIg?orgId=1
 which acts as a link to the `Who Attested To This` dashboard with the correct beacon block root & time range.

2. A `Who Attested To This` dashboard:
https://grafana.observability.ethpandaops.io/goto/jYIvntCIR?orgId=1
- requires a beacon block root, network and time range
- shows which validator indexes attested to that block root, can be downloaded in csv/json
- uses <@602753420033785856>'s blockprint data to take an educated guess at which CL's are attesting (will be useful in case a CL starts accepting invalid blocks?)
- might be able to wire up entity data too

If you need credentials reset for our Grafana just ping me (same goes for any other core dev!)

author: samcm
content: And here's a **bad** execution block -- we didn't see any attestations for it. https://grafana.observability.ethpandaops.io/goto/ngX9npCIR?orgId=1
